block.p: Peggy Bullard Horsley and Timothy Lee Barnes were married yesterday at Fearrington House Country Inn in Pittsboro, N.C. The Rev. Virginia Lee Wood, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

Mrs. Barnes, 54, is the director of fund-raising at the Seeing Eye, a school in Morristown, N.J., that trains and assigns guide dogs to the blind. She graduated cum laude from Salem College. She is a daughter of the late Clara Kale Bullard and the late Edgar W. Bullard, who lived in Belmont, N.C.
The couple were married Saturday at Fearrington House Country Inn in Pittsboro, N.C. The Rev. Virginia Lee Wood, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.
Peggy Bullard Horsley and Timothy Lee Barnes were married yesterday at Fearrington House Country Inn in Pittsboro, N.C. The Rev. Virginia Lee Wood, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

Mrs. Barnes, 54, is the director of fund-raising at the Seeing Eye, a school in Morristown, N.J., that trains and assigns guide dogs to the blind. She graduated cum laude from Salem College. She is a daughter of the late Clara Kale Bullard and the late Edgar W. Bullard, who lived in Belmont, N.C.

Mr. Barnes, 55, is a partner at Porzio, Bromberg & Newman, a law firm in Morristown, N.J. He graduated from Wake Forest and received his law degree from the University of Richmond. He is a son of the late Marilyn Louise Barnes and the late William O. Barnes Jr., who lived in Venice, Fla.
The couple's previous marriages ended in divorce.
